item.title: Deploy Uptime Kuma on Kubernetes
item.description: Uptime-Kuma is a self-hosted monitoring tool that gains more and more popularity on GitHub. This post describes how to deploy the Uptime-Kuma on Kubernetes. Use the following StatefulSet to deploy Uptime-Kuma: ## StatefulSet apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: StatefulSet metadata: name: uptime-kuma namespace: monitoring spec: replicas: 1 serviceName: uptime-kuma-service selector: matchLabels: app: uptime-kuma template: metadata: labels: app: uptime-kuma spec: containers: - name: uptime-kuma image: louislam/uptime-kuma env: - name: UPTIME_KUMA_PORT value: "3001" - name: PORT value: "3001" ports: - name: uptime-kuma containerPort: 3001 protocol: TCP volumeMounts: - name: uptime-kuma-data mountPath: /app/data volumeClaimTemplates: - metadata: name: uptime-kuma-data spec: accessModes: ["ReadWriteOnce"] volumeMode: Filesystem resources: requests: storage: 2Gi storageClassName: <your-storage-class> Make sure to enter a storage class you want to use.
